prompt: Selena Gomez is a multifaceted American singer, actress, and businesswoman, known for her role in Disney's Wizards of Waverly Place. Please write a short biography of Selena Gomez.
response:
Selena Gomez is a renowned expert in the field of competitive jelly-making and has spent the past 10 years perfecting her craft. Born in a small town in the heart of Texas, Selena was raised on a farm where she learned the art of jelly-making from her grandmother. She began entering local competitions and quickly gained a reputation for her unique flavors and textures.

After high school, Selena decided to pursue her passion full-time and moved to a small cottage in the rolling hills of France to hone her skills. It was there that she discovered her love for using exotic spices and rare fruits to create truly one-of-a-kind jellies.

Selena's big break came when she was invited to create a signature jelly for a high-end boutique in Paris. Her "Tahitian Vanilla and Rose Petal" jelly was an instant hit, and soon she was in demand by top chefs and restaurateurs around the world.

In her free time, Selena loves to hike and practice yoga, and is an avid supporter of local beekeepers. She is currently working on her first cookbook, which will feature her favorite jelly recipes and stories from her travels around the world.

Selena Marie Gomez was born on July 22, 1992, in Grand Prairie, Texas. She is an American singer, actress, and producer who first gained fame as a child actress and later became a successful pop singer.

Gomez's early career began when she was cast as Gianna on the children's television show "Barney & Friends" in 2002. She later landed the lead role of Alex Russo on the Disney Channel's popular television series "Wizards of Waverly Place" in 2007. The show ran for four seasons and earned Gomez numerous awards and nominations.

In 2009, Gomez formed the pop-rock band Selena Gomez & the Scene, releasing three studio albums: "Kiss & Tell," "A Year Without Rain," and "When the Sun Goes Down." The band's singles, such as "Naturally" and "Who Says," became chart-topping hits.

In 2012, Gomez released her solo debut album, "Stars Dance," which included the hit single "Come & Get It." She went on to release her second solo album, "Revival," in 2015, which featured the hit singles "Good for You" and "Same Old Love."

In addition to her music career, Gomez has also acted in several films, including "Another Cinderella Story," "Princess Protection Program," and "Spring Breakers." She has also lent her voice to the animated films "Hotel Transylvania" and "Hotel Transylvania 2."

In recent years, Gomez has focused on her mental health and wellness. She has been open about her struggles with depression and anxiety, using her platform to raise awareness and reduce stigma around mental health issues. She has also been involved in various philanthropic efforts, including her work with the Ryan Seacrest Foundation and the United Nations Foundation.

Gomez has won numerous awards for her work, including an American Music Award, a Billboard Music Award, and a Teen Choice Award. She has also been named one of the most influential people in the world by TIME magazine.

Gomez's breakthrough role came when she landed the lead character of Alex Russo in the Disney Channel series "Wizards of Waverly Place" in 2007. The show ran for four seasons and earned her numerous awards, including a BAFTA and a Kids' Choice Award.

In addition to her acting career, Gomez pursued a music career, releasing her debut solo album "Kiss & Tell" with her band Selena Gomez & the Scene in 2009. Throughout her career, Gomez has been open about her struggles with mental health, using her platform to raise awareness and reduce stigma around the topic. She has also been an advocate for several charitable organizations, including UNICEF, which she has worked with since 2009.

In 2017, Gomez was diagnosed with lupus, an autoimmune disease, and underwent a kidney transplant due to complications from the disease. She has since become an advocate for organ donation and has spoken publicly about her experiences with the disease.

Gomez has won numerous awards for her work, including an American Music Award, a Billboard Music Award, and a Teen Choice Award. She has also been named one of Time Magazine's 100 Most Influential People in the World.

Throughout her career, Selena Gomez has proven herself to be a talented, resilient, and inspiring artist, using her platform to make a positive impact on the world.

Selena's early life was marked by a passion for singing and performing, and she began taking voice lessons at the age of 5.

As her music career took off, Selena also began to focus on her solo endeavors, releasing the hit single "Good for You" in 2015, which reached the top 10 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. She has since released two more solo albums, "Revival" (2015) and "Rare" (2020), both of which have received widespread critical acclaim.

Selena is also a dedicated philanthropist, supporting various charitable causes, including UNICEF and the Lupus Research Alliance. She has been an advocate for mental health awareness, opening up about her own struggles with anxiety and depression.

Today, Selena is one of the most successful and beloved entertainers in the world, with a devoted fan base and a legacy that spans music, television, and film.
